### PR summary [21a2accea4](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13200/commits/21a2accea4b2665dde9198e17d50b7ec1b4f0207)

---

`+ Coloring.odd_length_iff_not_congr`

ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

bors merge

Looks reasonable to me now!

maintainer merge

Looks reasonable to me now!

maintainer merge
bors merge

Maybe this?
```suggestion
theorem Coloring.bicoloring_apply_iff_of_walk {Î±} {G : SimpleGraph Î±}
```
The `_general` is against the mathlib naming convention for theorems. Using `bicoloring` here is pushing it a little, though if we add this word to the module docs in this module it's fine.

Putting it into the `Coloring` namespace means you can use dot notation on `c` to access it. I also made the `G` argument implicit since it's implied by both `c` and `p`.

Perhaps
```suggestion
theorem Coloring.bicoloring_apply_iff_of_head_walk {Î±} {G : SimpleGraph Î±}
```

Perhaps
```suggestion
theorem Coloring.bicoloring_apply_iff_of_not_head_walk {Î±} {G : SimpleGraph Î±}
```

Yes, I think my lemma suggestion would be better if we also had `Odd p.length â†” (c u â†” Â¬ c v)` and `Odd p.length â†” (Â¬ c u â†” c v)`. Then you really can "rewrite `c v` to `c u` or `not (c u)` conditionally on whether or not `Even p.length` is true".

```suggestion
  rw [c.bicoloring_apply_iff_of_walk p]
```

```suggestion
  rw [c.bicoloring_apply_iff_of_walk p, Nat.even_iff_not_odd]
```

Maybe
```suggestion
theorem Coloring.even_length_iff_congr {Î±} {G : SimpleGraph Î±}
    (c : G.Coloring Bool) {u v : Î±} (p : G.Walk u v) :
    Even p.length â†” (c u â†” c v) := by
```
where you can use the (apparently missing!) lemmas `iff_assoc : (p â†” (q â†” r)) â†” ((p â†” q) â†” r)`, `iff_left_comm : (p â†” (q â†” r)) â†” (q â†” (p â†” r))` and `iff_assoc : ((p â†” q) â†” r) â†” ((p â†” r) â†” q)` and the existing `iff_comm` to get back to your original statement

I think `Coloring.bicoloring_apply_iff_of_walk` is the more useful form. The point of this is that you can rewrite `c v` to `c u` or `not (c u)` conditionally on whether or not `Even p.length` is true.

The `Coloring.even_length_iff_congr` form is nice and symmetric though, so it could be worth having around too.

I suspect what we actually want is `Even p.length â†” (c u â†” c v)` and `Odd p.length â†” (c u â†” Â¬ c v)`(/`Odd p.length â†” (Â¬ c u â†” c v)` so that we really "can rewrite `c v` to `c u` or `not (c u)` conditionally on whether or not `Even p.length` is true"

@YaelDillies The benefit of the `Coloring.bicoloring_apply_iff_of_walk` formulation is that it introduces the `Even p.length` term. I think many times you won't have `Even p.length` or `Odd p.length` in context or in an easy-to-express form. It's using `â†”` more like a boolean operator to conditionally negate.
I guess I am missing the greater context here

Hmm... the fact that these are Bool-valued rather than Prop-valued walks makes the use case I have in mind not work very well. The statement would need to be `c u = (c v == decide (Even p.length))` instead.

I think in many cases, you would also want the forms `Even p.length -> c u = c v` and `Odd p.length -> c u = ! c v`, since that way the `Even`/`Odd` conditions can create new goals. The purpose is to be able to use a walk to rewrite `c u` to `c v`.

I added the `Even p.length â†” (c u â†” c v)` and `Odd p.length â†” (Â¬c u â†” c v)` versions
I also added missing `iff_assoc`, `iff_left_comm` ans some more (witch may need better names) for probing the other theorems from one. I added them in `Mathlib/Init/Logic.lean`, but maybe you think that they should go somewhere else
The proof is just `tauto`, hopefully?
`tauto` is not available here. It is defined in a file that depends on this one. Maybe I can move these theorems somewhere else, but I don't now exactly where it will be a good place
Maybe I should move them to `Mathlib/Logic/Basic.lean`?
`tauto` also depend on `Mathlib/Logic/Basic.lean`, but I moved it any way for using `iff_not_comm`
You should move them to `Logic.Lemmas`. That's exactly the place for "Wants to go in `Logic.Basic` but uses an advanced tactic"
You're missing `iff_right_comm`
This is `iff_true_left`
This is `iff_false_left`
This is basically `not_iff_comm`, `iff_not_comm`.

```suggestion
theorem iff_assoc {a b c : Prop} : ((a â†” b) â†” c) â†” (a â†” (b â†” c)) := by tauto
```
to match `mul_assoc`

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Combinatorics/SimpleGraph): Add theorems about the coloring of the ends of a walk in a bicolored graph
